docs.snippet: The following are remarks from Senator Barack Obama's victory speech in Columbia, S.C.     '' Well, tonight, the cynics who believed that what began in the snows of Iowa was just an illusion were told a different story by the good people of South ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The following are remarks from Senator Barack Obama's victory speech in Columbia, S.C. '' Well, tonight, the cynics who believed that what began in the snows of Iowa was just an illusion were told a different story by the good people of South Carolina. After four great contests, in every corner of this country, we have the most votes, the most delegates and the most diverse coalition of Americans that we've seen in a long, long time. ...
docs.abstract: Excerpts from remarks by Sen Barack Obama's victory speech in South Carolina's Democratic presidential primary

docs.snippet: Jerome R. Corsi went to Kenya on Tuesday to publicize his newest book, ''The Obama Nation,'' a work full of unsubstantiated accusations about Senator Barack Obama's drug use, his connections to Islam and his relationships with Kenyan politicians, ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Jerome R. Corsi went to Kenya on Tuesday to publicize his newest book, ''The Obama Nation,'' a work full of unsubstantiated accusations about Senator Barack Obama's drug use, his connections to Islam and his relationships with Kenyan politicians, among other things. The chairs and microphone were all set up in one of the biggest hotels in Nairobi, and the room was crowded with journalists eager to hear what Mr. Corsi would say about the man who is adored in Kenya like a native son. (Mr. Obama's father was Kenyan.) But the presentation was not to be.
docs.abstract: Kenyan immigration agents whisk Jerome R Corsi away from press conference in Nairobi and deport him for filing misleading immigration forms; he was in Kenya to promote his book The Obama Nation, work full of unsubstantiated accusations about Sen BaracK Obama, who is adored in Kenya; photo (S)

byline.original: By JEFFREY GETTLEMAN WITH KENNEDY ABWAO

docs.snippet: ''The liars are back,'' Senator John Kerry wrote in the subject line of an e-mail message. ''Time to finish them off.''      The message, sent to his supporters on Wednesday, announced that Mr. Kerry, Democrat of Massachusetts, had started a Web s...
docs.lead_paragraph: ''The liars are back,'' Senator John Kerry wrote in the subject line of an e-mail message. ''Time to finish them off.'' The message, sent to his supporters on Wednesday, announced that Mr. Kerry, Democrat of Massachusetts, had started a Web site devoted to tracking smears against Democrats during the presidential campaign.
docs.abstract: The Caucus column reports Sen John Kerry has started Web site to track smears against Democrats during presidential campaign; reports site has made special note of Jerome R Corsi book The Obama Nation, which makes several questionable accusations about Barack Obama; notes that Kerry was subject of smear campaign in 2004 election; photo (M)

docs.snippet: Oops, he did it again. Joe Biden speaks truth to power (the president) on gay marriage....
docs.lead_paragraph: Oops, he did it again. Joe Biden speaks truth to power (the president) on gay marriage.
docs.abstract: Maureen Dowd Op-Ed column maintains that the perception of Pres Obama as cool and distant is bolstered by accounts taken from the diaries of Genevieve Cook, who was once Obama's lover; observes that Obama's support for gay marriage reflects his caution, as it was only expressed after Vice Pres Joseph R Biden Jr forced Obama's hand.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships

docs.snippet: An early letter by Mr. Obama is remarkable because he regarded T. S. Eliot’s conservatism with seriousness and sympathy....
docs.lead_paragraph: An early letter by Mr. Obama is remarkable because he regarded T. S. Eliot’s conservatism with seriousness and sympathy.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Adam Kirsch, senior editor at The New Republic, reflects on an early letter written by undergraduate Barack Obama about the poet T S Eliot, which is included in an excerpt from the David Maraniss book Barack Obama: The Story.
